title: Safari
description: My primary web browser on all devices.

title: Mail
description: How I read email, although I prefer not to.

title: Fantastical
description: A great macOS/iOS calandar app.

title: Things
description: If you are a fan of GTD, this task manager is perfect.

title: Rectangle
description: To wrangle windows on macOS.

title: Backblaze
description: Simple external backups.

title: Apple Music
description: I'm a recent convert to the service, warts and all.

title: Raycast
description: For finding files and running automations on macOS.

title: Notion
description: As a personal wiki.

title: NetNewsWire
description: For reading RSS feeds.

title: Overcast
description: For listening to podcasts.

title: 1Password
description: For managing passwords.

title: Figma
description: For wireframing, prototyping & general UI / UX design.

title: FigJam
description: A collaborative white-board, which is perfect for remote workshops.

title: Pixelmator Pro
description: For photo editing.

title: iA Writer
description: For long-form writing.

title: Drafts
description: For taking notes, and for first drafts of anything written

title: Neovim
description: Is my code-editor of choice, once you start thinking in vim it's hard to use anything else.

title: Kitty
description: Is a fast, lightweight terminal emulator, that can be configured easily in a single file.

title: Fish
description: A modern terminal shell that has great auto-complete, syntax highlighting, and history searching.

title: FZF
description: The ultimate way to trawl through files and history on the command line.

title: RTX
description: A universal solution to manage the versions of all the programming languages I need.

title: Apple MacBook Pro 16-inch
description: Is my primary work device. It is configured with the Apple M2 Pro, 32GB RAM and 512GB SSD.

title: Apple Mac mini
description: Is my personal work device. It is configured with the Apple M1, 16GB RAM and 1TB SSD.

title: Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max
description: is my primary personal device.

title: Apple iPad Air (5th Generation)
description: is my secondary personal device.

title: IKEA Bekant Desk
description: This sit-stand desk is a perfect mix of aesthetic and functionality. It's done wonders for my posture and energy.

title: Herman Miller Aeron Chair
description: Is the best ergonomic chair ever. They are very expensive, but this second-hand 15+ year old example is still solid as a rock.

title: Apple Studio Display
description: A bright, 5K, color-correct display, in a beautifully designed package. Paired with my work devices.

title: RAMA Kara Keyboard
description: A very high-quality, modular, mechanical keyboard. I bought it as part of the first group-buy in 2020.

title: Owlab Voice Mini Macropad
description: A neat little macropad with real mechanical keys, and rotating wheel. I use this control music and mute my microphone during calls.

title: Apple Magic Mouse
description: As a mouse, a lot of people hate it, I don't.

title: Apple Airpods Pro
description: For listening to music & video calls. The noise cancelling is great.

title: Shure MV7 Microphone
description: Total overkill? Yes. Excellent sound quality? Yes. Makes me look like a podcaster? Absolutely.

title: Blue Compass Arm
description: To mount the microphone.

title: Leuchtturm1917 Notebook
description: For taking notes and task management (A5, softcover, dotted, black).
